meanings.definition: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The clear water in the lake reflected the blue sky above.
meanings.sent2: Fish need water to swim and survive.
meanings.sent3: The water in the bottle jumped out when it was squeezed too hard.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like deep pools of water, reflecting the emotions within.
meanings.sent5: The water flowed gently downstream, carrying fallen leaves with it.

meanings.definition: To pour or sprinkle water on; make wet.
meanings.sent1: She will water the plants in the garden every morning.
meanings.sent2: The farmer needed to water the crops to help them grow.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally watered his shoes while trying to fill the bucket.
meanings.sent4: The rain watered the thirsty earth, bringing life to the dry land.
meanings.sent5: The gardener carefully watered each flower, ensuring they thrived in the sunlight.
